books.author: by Robert A. Caro
books.description: From 1958 through the Kennedy assassination; the fourth volume of “The Years of Lyndon Johnson.”
books.name: THE PASSAGE OF POWER

books.author: by Jose A. Rodriguez Jr. with Bill Harlow
books.description: A retired C.I.A. official claims the agency’s methods saved American lives after 9/11.
books.name: HARD MEASURES

books.author: by Charles Duhigg
books.description: A Times reporter’s account of the science behind how we form, and break, habits.
books.name: THE POWER OF HABIT

books.author: by Peter L. Bergen
books.description: The 10-year search for Osama bin Laden.
books.name: MANHUNT

books.author: by Anna Quindlen
books.description: The journalist and novelist, now nearly 60, looks back at her experiences and those of her generation.
books.name: LOTS OF CANDLES, PLENTY OF CAKE

books.author: by Todd Burpo with Lynn Vincent
books.description: A father recounts his 3-year-old son’s encounter with Jesus and the angels during an appendectomy.
books.name: HEAVEN IS FOR REAL

books.author: by Erik Larson
books.description: William E. Dodd, the U.S. ambassador to Germany, and his daughter, Martha, in 1930s Berlin.
books.name: IN THE GARDEN OF BEASTS

books.author: by Laura Hillenbrand
books.description: An Olympic runner’s story of survival as a prisoner of the Japanese in World War II.
books.name: UNBROKEN

books.author: by Jenny Lawson
books.description: A blogger recalls her unusual upbringing.
books.name: LET'S PRETEND THIS NEVER HAPPENED

books.author: by Madeleine Albright with Bill Woodward
books.description: The former secretary of state describes her family’s life in Czechoslovakia, where she was born; their exile in London during World War II; their return to their homeland after the war and their final move to the United States in 1948.
books.name: PRAGUE WINTER

books.author: by Walter Isaacson
books.description: A biography of the recently deceased entrepreneur, based on 40 interviews with Jobs conducted over two years.
books.name: STEVE JOBS

books.author: by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
books.description: The anchor of “The O’Reilly Factor” recounts the assassination of Abraham Lincoln.
books.name: KILLING LINCOLN

books.author: by Rachel Maddow
books.description: America’s path to war has become too easy, with excessive power ceded to the executive branch, the MSNBC host argues.
books.name: DRIFT

books.author: by Clint Hill
books.description: Recollections of the Secret Service agent assigned to guard Jacqueline Kennedy.
books.name: MRS. KENNEDY AND ME
